channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump says he took a cognitive test as part of his latest physical
item.description: President Trump had his first physical of his second term on Friday at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center.

item.title: Trump administration ends temporary protected status for thousands of Afghans
item.description: As soon as May 20, thousands of Afghans living in the U.S. will lose a protection that shielded them from deportation and allowed them to work.

item.title: Apr 11: CBS News 24/7, 1pm ET
item.description: Markets react to the latest escalation in the U.S. and China trade war; CBS' Gayle King prepares for journey to space on Monday.

item.title: Witkoff meets Putin as Trump urges Russia to 'get moving' on Ukraine ceasefire
item.description: The US envoy holds a third round of talks with the Russian president as agreement on a truce remains elusive.

item.title: What to know about activist Mahmoud Khalil and his attorneys’ plan to appeal his deportation ruling
5 of 6 victims of Hudson River helicopter crash were tourists from Spain
item.description: Five of the six victims of the Hudson River helicopter crash in NYC have been identified as Siemens executive Agustin Escobar Canadas and his family.

item.title: Deadly crash raises new questions about safety of New York’s helicopter tours
Trump to end protected status for Afghans and Cameroonians
item.description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem found the conditions in both countries no longer merited US protections, a statement says.

item.title: LA County judge allows Menendez brothers' resentencing hearing to proceed
item.description: A judge ruled in favor of the Menendez brothers Friday afternoon, allowing their resentencing hearing to move forward despite opposition from the Los ...

item.title: 4/11: CBS Evening News
item.description: DOJ faces questions about return of man mistakenly deported to El Salvador; Gayle King is heading to space

item.title: Supreme Court rules Trump officials must 'facilitate' release of man deported to El Salvador
item.description: The government has said Kilmar Abrego Garcia was deported in error, but has resisted returning him to the US.

item.title: Coup leader seeks win in first vote since Gabon army takeover
item.description: About one million voters are set to pick their next president from a list of eight hopefuls.

item.title: Judge allows Columbia graduate Mahmoud Khalil's deportation
item.description: Mahmoud Khalil was arrested in March for his role in pro-Palestinian protests at Columbia University.

item.title: Woman believed to be the only person with unnamed genetic disorder

item.title: Dozens of USAID contracts were canceled last weekend. Here's what happened
item.description: The rationale was to address "mismanagement, fraud, and misaligned priorities." Former USAID official Jeremy Konyndyk said reversals and inconsistence...

item.title: 'I cannot guarantee complete confidentiality,' VA therapists ordered to tell veterans
item.description: Mental health therapists at Veterans Affairs should begin sessions with patients saying they are in a shared office space, a memo obtained by NPR says...

item.title: How Trump's immigration policy changes who gets arrested and detained
item.description: During his second Presidential campaign, Donald Trump vowed to carry out the largest deportation program the U.S. has ever seen. And true to his word ...

item.title: Columbia University activist Mahmoud Khalil can be deported, immigration judge rules
